text: Kiha & The Faces (Korean: 장기하와 얼굴들) was a South Korean indie rock band lead by singer Chang Kiha. The band debuted in 2008 with the single, "Cheap Coffee," and have since become one of South Korea's most popular and commercially successful indie rock bands. ==Members== ===Former members=== * Chang Kiha - Vocals, Guitar * Lee Min-ki - Guitar * Jeong Jung-yeop - Bass guitar * Lee Jong-min - Keyboard * Yohei Hasegawa - Guitar * Jeon Il-jun - Drum * Mimi Sisters - Dance, Chorus * Kim Hyeon-ho - Drum ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="1" style="width:5em;" | Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Sales |- ! |- ! scope="row" | "That's Just What You Think" (그건 니 생각이고) | rowspan="2" | 2018 | — | | rowspan="2" |Mono |- ! scope="row" | "Nothing After All" (별거 아니라고) | — | |- |} == Awards and nominations == === Cyworld Digital Music Awards === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 50%;" !Year !Category !Recipient !Result |- |2009 |Tam Eum Mania Award |"The Moon is Waxing, Let's Go" | |} === Golden Disc Awards === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 50%;" !Year !Category !Recipient !Result |- |2009 |Rock Award |"Cheap Coffee" | |} === Korean Music Awards === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 50%;" !Year !Category !Recipient !Result |- | rowspan="3" |2009 |Song of the Year | rowspan="2" |"Cheap Coffee" | |- |Best Rock Song | |- |Male Musicians of the Year Netizen Vote | rowspan="2" |Kiha & The Faces | |- | rowspan="4" |2012 |Musician of the Year | |- |Album of the Year | rowspan="2" |Kiha & The Faces | |- |Best Rock Album | |- |Best Rock Song |"That Kind of Relationship" | |} === Mnet Asian Music Awards === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 50%;" !Year !Category !Recipient !Result |- |2009 | rowspan="2" |Best Band Performance |"Living Without Incidents" | |- |2011 |"Just Know Each Other" | |} == Honors == In 2012, Kiha & The Faces were given the South Korean Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism Commendation for increasing public interest in indie music through their songs. ==References== ==External links== * Category:South Korean indie rock groups Category:South Korean folk rock groups Category:Korean Music Award winners Category:Musical groups established in 2008 Category:Musical groups disestablished in 2018
